description:
Job Description
  
 
 
 
   Candidates are invited to apply for the temporary part-time (60 hours bi-weekly) position for our long-term care facility in Ottawa, Ontario.
 
 
 
   Reporting to the Director of Care; the Clinical Coordinator assists with clinical supervision and programs impacting on delivery of care, including but not limited to, Orientation, In-service education, Infection Control and Continuous Quality Improvement.
 
 
 
   RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
   Developing and implementing annual education plan to staff
   Attend and participate in committee meetings
   Provide frontline presence on the units to support, evaluate and better understand quality and educational opportunities.
   Identify gaps in training and education and develop solutions
   Adheres to established policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, fire, safety, and environment and infection control.
   Other duties as deemed necessary for operational requirements.
 
 
 
   QUALIFICATIONS
 
 
   Registered Nurse/ BSCN preferred
   CNO Registration
   RNAO registration preferred
   Demonstrated knowledge of clinical issues for geriatric residents, infection control, principles of adult education and Continuous Quality Improvement.
   Knowledgeable in principles and philosophy of long-term care.
   Previous long-term care experience and knowledge preferred
   Familiarity and understanding of electronic health record systems i.e. PCC, RAI/MDS, RUGS, E-MAR, POC tablets – asset
   Knowledge of LTC industry regulatory requirements and current Best Practices - asset
   Ability to work independently and be self-directed
   Excellent written and oral communication
 
 
 
   #ExtendicareOttawaclinical coordinator
 
 
 
   Time Type:
 
  Full time
 
 
  
    When you choose to build your career with Extendicare, you’re joining a team dedicated to making a difference. By focusing our energy on enriching the lives of our residents every day, we transform both the quality of their lives and the quality of our own work experiences.
  
 
 
 
  
    If you have a passion for caring, turn it into a rewarding career with Extendicare!
  
 
 
 
   Extendicare and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes upon request.
